other_tests.findings: Closure of the neovascular membrane, no evident subretinal fluid, visual acuity improved from 20/60 to 20/40 three weeks after treatment. Nine weeks later, a microscopic hyperfluorescent spot was observed, with a small area of shallow subretinal fluid, and visual acuity decreased to 20/50. Thirty-four weeks later, visual acuity was 20/60, subretinal fluid resolved.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial improvement in visual acuity and closure of the neovascular membrane after three weeks, slight deterioration by nine weeks, followed by stabilization at 20/60 with no signs of active CNV 34 weeks after treatment.

other_tests.findings: Positive for a defect in chromosome 2p16â€“21 characteristic of mallatia leventinese.
